body.p: This page contains information about the FreeBSD/i386 platform. FreeBSD/i386 should support any CPU compatible with the Intel™ 80486 or better in 32-bit mode, although almost every recent AMD™ and Intel™ CPU will also be capable of running in 64-bit mode using the FreeBSD/amd64 port.

FreeBSD/i386 supports up to 4GiB of RAM by default. Machines with more RAM will either need to run FreeBSD/amd64 or run with
Physical Address Extension (PAE) enabled in order to make use of any memory above the 4GiB boundary.
FreeBSD/i386 runs in 32-bit multiuser mode, in both Uniprocessor and Multiprocessor mode.
The i386 platform is a Tier 1 FreeBSD platform.
